history.proof: unfold Proper, Same_set. intros x' H. qsimpl time: 2. split. - hauto use: Extensionality_Ensembles unfold: Same_set, Included. - hauto use: Extensionality_Ensembles unfold: Same_set, Included.

exceptions.tactic: intros P P' PP' Q Q' QQ' x.

exceptions.exn: The reference PP' was not found in the current environment.
Wrong bullet -: Current bullet - is not finished.
The reference QQ' was not found in the current environment.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type

Goal:
Proper (Same_set ==> Same_set ==> Same_set) (Intersection A)

Premises:
Same_set = fun (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) => Included B C /\ Included C B : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Prop Argument U is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
Proper = let U := Type in fun (A : U) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (m : A) => R m m : forall A : Type, Relation_Definitions.relation A -> A -> Prop Argument A is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope signature_scope _]
Intersection : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Ensemble U
Union_proper : forall V : Type, Proper (Same_set ==> Same_set ==> Same_set) (Union V)
complement_proper : forall V : Type, Proper (Same_set ==> Same_set) (Complement V)
Included_proper : forall V : Type, Proper (Same_set ==> Same_set ==> iff) Included
Disjoint_proper : forall V : Type, Proper (Same_set ==> Same_set ==> iff) (Disjoint V)
Complement_Empty_set : forall A : Type, Same_set (Complement A (Empty_set A)) (Full_set A)
Intersection_assoc : forall (A : Type) (P Q R : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A (Intersection A P Q) R) (Intersection A P (Intersection A Q R))
Intersection_Union_distr_r : forall (A : Type) (P Q R : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A P (Union A Q R)) (Union A (Intersection A P Q) (Intersection A P R))
Intersection_Union_distr_l : forall (A : Type) (P Q R : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A (Union A Q R) P) (Union A (Intersection A Q P) (Intersection A R P))
Intersection_comm : forall (A : Type) (P Q : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A P Q) (Intersection A Q P)
PeanoNat.Nat.recursion_wd : forall Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation ?A, Proper (Aeq ==> (eq ==> Aeq ==> Aeq) ==> eq ==> Aeq) PeanoNat.Nat.recursion where ?A : [A : Type |- Type]
PeanoNat.Nat.mul_wd = PeanoNat.Nat.mul_wd_obligation_1 : Proper (eq ==> eq ==> eq) Nat.mul
PeanoNat.Nat.testbit_wd = PeanoNat.Nat.testbit_wd_obligation_1 : Proper (eq ==> eq ==> eq) PeanoNat.Nat.testbit
PeanoNat.Nat.mod_wd = PeanoNat.Nat.mod_wd_obligation_1 : Proper (eq ==> eq ==> eq) PeanoNat.Nat.modulo
BinNat.N.lt_compat = BinNat.N.lt_wd : Proper (eq ==> eq ==> iff) BinNat.N.lt
BinNat.N.testbit_wd = reflexive_proper BinNat.N.testbit : Proper (BinNat.N.eq ==> BinNat.N.eq ==> eq) BinNat.N.testbit
BinNat.N.div_wd = reflexive_proper BinNat.N.div : Proper (BinNat.N.eq ==> BinNat.N.eq ==> BinNat.N.eq) BinNat.N.div
BinNat.N.mul_wd = reflexive_proper BinNat.N.mul : Proper (BinNat.N.eq ==> BinNat.N.eq ==> BinNat.N.eq) BinNat.N.mul
BinInt.Z.mul_wd = reflexive_proper BinInt.Z.mul : Proper (BinInt.Z.eq ==> BinInt.Z.eq ==> BinInt.Z.eq) BinInt.Z.mul
BinNat.N.lt_wd = reflexive_proper BinNat.N.lt : Proper (BinNat.N.eq ==> BinNat.N.eq ==> iff) BinNat.N.lt
BinNat.N.mod_wd = reflexive_proper BinNat.N.modulo : Proper (BinNat.N.eq ==> BinNat.N.eq ==> BinNat.N.eq) BinNat.N.modulo
BinNat.N.pow_wd = reflexive_proper BinNat.N.pow : Proper (BinNat.N.eq ==> BinNat.N.eq ==> BinNat.N.eq) BinNat.N.pow
BinNat.N.add_wd = reflexive_proper BinNat.N.add : Proper (BinNat.N.eq ==> BinNat.N.eq ==> BinNat.N.eq) BinNat.N.add
BinInt.Z.mod_wd = reflexive_proper BinInt.Z.modulo : Proper (BinInt.Z.eq ==> BinInt.Z.eq ==> BinInt.Z.eq) BinInt.Z.modulo
BinInt.Z.testbit_wd = reflexive_proper BinInt.Z.testbit : Proper (BinInt.Z.eq ==> BinInt.Z.eq ==> eq) BinInt.Z.testbit
Intersection_absort_left : forall (U : Type) (A B : Ensemble U), Included B A -> Same_set (Intersection U A B) B
Intersection_absort_right : forall (U : Type) (A B : Ensemble U), Included A B -> Same_set (Intersection U A B) A
Intersection_Full_left : forall P : Ensemble ?A, Same_set (Intersection ?A (Full_set ?A) P) P where ?A : [A : Type |- Type]
Intersection_Full_right : forall P : Ensemble ?A, Same_set (Intersection ?A P (Full_set ?A)) P where ?A : [A : Type |- Type]
Intersection_Empty_right : forall P : Ensemble ?A, Same_set (Intersection ?A P (Empty_set ?A)) (Empty_set ?A) where ?A : [A : Type |- Type]
Intersection_Empty_left : forall P : Ensemble ?A, Same_set (Intersection ?A (Empty_set ?A) P) (Empty_set ?A) where ?A : [A : Type |- Type]
Record ring_eq_ext (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_reqe { Radd_ext : Proper (req ==> req ==> req) radd; Rmul_ext : Proper (req ==> req ==> req) rmul; Ropp_ext : Proper (req ==> req) ropp } For ring_eq_ext: Argument R is implicit For mk_reqe: Arguments R, radd, rmul, ropp, req are implicit For ring_eq_ext: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope] For mk_reqe: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope _ _ _]
Intersection_Complement : forall (A : Type) (P Q : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A (Complement A P) (Complement A Q)) (Complement A (Union A P Q))
BinNat.N.Rlt_wd : forall z : BinNums.N, Proper (eq ==> eq ==> iff) (fun n m : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.le z n /\ BinNat.N.lt n m)
BinNat.N.Rgt_wd : forall z : BinNums.N, Proper (eq ==> eq ==> iff) (fun n m : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.lt m n /\ BinNat.N.le n z)
Ring_polynom.rmul_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Proper (req ==> req ==> req) rmul
Ring_polynom.radd_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Proper (req ==> req ==> req) radd
Ring_theory.Rmul_ext : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Proper (req ==> req ==> req) rmul
InitialRing.radd_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Proper (req ==> req ==> req) radd
Ring_theory.Radd_ext : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Proper (req ==> req ==> req) radd
Field_theory.pow_N_ext : forall (R : Type) (rI : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Proper (req ==> eq ==> req) (Ring_theory.pow_N rI rmul)

```coq
unfold Proper, Same_set. intros P P' PP' Q Q' QQ' x.
intros x' H.
destruct H as [HP HQ].
split.
- apply PP', HP.
- apply QQ', HQ.
Qed.
```
